heel.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the curved back part of your foot
heel.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the raised part on the bottom of a shoe that makes the shoe higher at the back
heel.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the part of a sock that covers your heel
heel.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the part of your hand between the bottom of your thumb and your wrist
heel.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Using the heel of your hand, press the dough firmly into shape.
heel.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The decision to buy Peters came hard on the heels of the clubâ€™s promotion to Division One.
heel.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: following closely behind someone, especially in order to catch or attack them
heel.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: With the enemy army hard on his heels, he crossed the Somme at Blanche-Taque.
heel.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a man who behaves badly towards other people
heel.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to put a heel on a shoe
heel.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used to tell your dog to walk next to you
